IP2025023_syn_1:
Indication: Recurrent right effusion.
Procedure: US-guided Thoracentesis.
Action: 900mL clear fluid removed.
Complication: None.
Plan: Discharge.
IP2025023_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Ultrasound-guided therapeutic thoracentesis.
NARRATIVE: The right hemithorax was scanned, id[REDACTED] a locatable pocket of fluid in the 8th intercostal space. Under local anesthesia, a catheter was introduced and 900 mL of clear serous fluid was aspirated. The patient tolerated the procedure without complication.
IP2025023_syn_3:
CPT 32555: Thoracentesis, therapeutic, with imaging guidance.
Details: Ultrasound guidance utilized to id[REDACTED] pocket. 900 mL fluid removed via catheter. No pleural biopsy performed.
IP2025023_syn_4:
Procedure Note
Patient: [REDACTED]
Procedure: Thoracentesis
Steps:
1. Ultrasound check.
2. Local numbing.
3. Needle/catheter in.
4. Drained 900cc.
5. Pulled catheter, bandaged.
Plan: Home.
IP2025023_syn_5: Isabel Morales thoracentesis note. She has heart failure fluid on the right. We used the ultrasound to find a spot. Drained 900ml of clear fluid. She felt better. Sent her home.
IP2025023_syn_6: Right posterior 8th intercostal space chosen under ultrasound guidance. 900 mL of clear serous fluid removed via catheter system. No complications occurred. Patient discharged home.
IP2025023_syn_7:
[Indication]
Recurrent right pleural effusion (HF).
[Anesthesia]
Local.
[Description]
US-guided thoracentesis. 900mL serous fluid drained.
[Plan]
Discharge.
IP2025023_syn_8: [REDACTED] drained from her right lung due to heart failure. We used ultrasound to guide a small tube into the fluid pocket and drained 900 mL. She tolerated it well and was breathing better afterwards. She was discharged home.
IP2025023_syn_9:
Procedure: Image-guided pleural drainage.
Action: 900mL liquid aspirated via percutaneous catheter.
Outcome: Symptom relief.
IP2025023:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Ultrasound-guided therapeutic thoracentesis.
Patient: [REDACTED], 73-year-old female with recurrent right pleural effusion due to heart failure.
Anesthesia: Local anesthesia with lidocaine and mild anxiolysis.
Procedure details: Right posterior 8th intercostal space chosen under ultrasound guidance. 900 mL of clear serous fluid removed via catheter system. Opening pressure not formally measured.
Complications: None; no cough or chest pain.
Disposition: Discharged home after brief observation.
